msDesc.head: Bernard of Clairvaux; Willelmus Peraldus. Germany, s. xiv2/4.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 736–743. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: De consideratione
msItem.note: With prologue (ed.: PL 182. 727A–808A; SBO 3 (1963) 393–493; Leclercq, Recueil, 3. 38; Bloomfield 5830). No chapter division.

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Homiliae quattuor super Missus est
msItem.note: with preface (ed.: PL 183. 55C–88A; SBO 4 (1966) 13–58; Stegmüller RB, 1726; Schneyer, Wegweiser, 457; Schneyer 1. 442. 8–12).
(fol. 69v, l. 29) Note on main text in a Carthusian hand from Mainz, s. xv.

msItem.author: Willelmus Peraldus
msItem.title: De eruditione religiosorum
msItem.note: With prologue (pr. Paris, 1512 and 1622; Louvain, 1575, etc.; Glorieux, Rép., 106f; Kaeppeli 1625, citing the present MS.; Bloomfield 1939 and 4610).
(fol. 72r) list of books (‘Materie librorum’), parts, and chapters, the latter numbered.
Soliloquium, divided into five sections: the things that lead to Christ’s love, and to contempt for the world; a note on doomsday, infernal penalties, and the joy of paradise.

supportDesc.support: parchment; remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes) and beginning of major and minor textual units indicated by bookmarks: red-coloured leather tabs, glued to both sides of the outer margins (fols 2, 7, 15, 88, 107 and 180).
supportDesc.extent: iii (17th cent.) + 216 + i (17th cent.) leaves c.245–50 165–70
supportDesc.foliation: i, ii, 1–218, in modern (19th-cent.) pencil. Fol. 1 is a 17th-century endleaf. Medieval foliation at the upper right-hand corner of a recto, in arabic numerals, 1–141, inserted in a hand of s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in ink, one column (except for fols 72va–75vb in two columns) of 32 lines. Ruled space c.176–82 104–09

handDesc.handNote: German textualis formata, s. xiv2/4, in a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Flourished initials with good borders in red, blue and brown (fols 2r, 15r, 22r, 39v, 70r, 75v, 91ar, 107v, 145v and 180r).
Coloured initials in red and blue.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 14th-/15th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the lower margin of fol. 2r: ‘Iste liber est Cartusiensium prope magunciam’, fol. 69v (in red): ‘liber carthusiensium prope mogunciam’, and, in the same hand, at the lower left-hand margin of fol. 217v: ‘codex carthusiensium moguncie’; the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the upper right-hand margin of fol. 2r: ‘Liber Carthusiensium prope magunciam’, and, in the same hand, at the head of fol. 217v: ‘Liber Carthusiensium prope Magunciam’. Identifiable as C XIIII P in cat. ii.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1v.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Decoration, localization and date follow Pächt and Alexander (1966). Quarto Catalogue, col. 194 Quarto Catalogue, col. 195 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 58
